channel.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
channel.description:
As @SmartOne suggested. It would be really cool to have a wiki with useful links. Simply edit this topic and away you go!
## Blogs * [Security blog(s) overview](https://workhack.com/security ) * [Penetration Testing Blog](https://hrushikeshk.github.io/) by @hkh4cks
## News * [The Hacker News](https://thehackernews.com/) * [Security Affairs](http://securityaffairs.co/wordpress/) * [WIRED (Security Category)](https://www.wired.com/category/security/) * [SANS Newsletter(s)](https://www.sans.org/newsletters/) (For NewsBites, you get to view opinions from the Editorial Board of SANS alongside the news)
## Git repos * [Awesome-Hacking](https://github.com/Hack-with-Github/Awesome-Hacking/blob/master/README.md) * [low level](https://low-level.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) (Resources and articles for (but not limited to): reversing, security, ...etc.) * [Math Symbols as Code](https://github.com/Jam3/math-as-code) (cheat-sheet for explaining different math symbols as code) * [Hacker Roadmap](https://github.com/SundownDEV/hacker-roadmap) (overview of pentesting and helpful for beginners) * [Hacking Security Ebooks](https://github.com/yeahhub/Hacking-Security-Ebooks)(Free Security E-books to Download) * [H4cker by The Art of Hacking](https://github.com/The-Art-of-Hacking/h4cker) * [Awesome Hacking Search Engines](https://github.com/edoardottt/awesome-hacker-search-engines)
## Tutorials * [Cybrary - Online Free CyberSec Training](https://www.cybrary.it/) * [OpenSecurityTraining](http://opensecuritytraining.info/) (Similar to Cybrary) * [Crash Course - Computer Science Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8dPuuaLjXtNlUrzyH5r6jN9ulIgZBpdo) [YT Channel] * [Computerphile](https://www.youtube.com/user/Computerphile/videos) [YT Channel] * [Hackers Arise](https://www.hackers-arise.com)
## Misc * [Every book in existence](http://gen.lib.rus.ec) - Where DMCA's power doesn't reach. * [Defcon Media Server](https://media.defcon.org/) - Contents of every defcon to date (include presentations' videos) * [Security Resources: Beginner to advanced for all security folks!](https://hrushikeshk.github.io/blog/2018/01/15/security-resources/) * [Wireless Passwords from Aiports & Lounges around the World](https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=1Z1dI8hoBZSJNWFx2xr_MMxSxSxY&ll=-3.81666561775622e-14%2C39.73991410000008&z=1) * [Surveillance Self-Defense](https://ssd.eff.org/) * [Free Programming Books](https://github.com/EbookFoundation/free-programming-books) * [Password Lists](https://github.com/danielmiessler/SecLists/tree/master/Passwords) * [Free IT eBooks](http://it-ebooks.directory/) * [NIST Computer Security Resource Center](https://beta.csrc.nist.gov/Publications/Search?requestControlFamilyList=&requestSeriesList=1,&requestStatusList=1,3,&requestDisplayOption=basic&requestSortOrder=5) - Special Publications * [DoX Format](https://paste.0x00sec.org/raw/norizusona) * [SmashTheStack fileserver](http://labs.sawbox.net/txt) - Contains a very good disassembly tutorial, and some other goodies * [Ansible vs Puppet vs Chef vs Salt vs Docker vs Vagrant ](https://gist.github.com/jaceklaskowski/bd3d06489ec004af6ed9) * [A list of VPS hosts that accept Bitcoin](http://cryto.net/~joepie91/bitcoinvps.html) * [FuzzySecurity](http://fuzzysecurity.com/) - Contains a lot of tutorials and information about exploit development and low level security in general * [azeria-labs](https://azeria-labs.com) - Great content about shellcoding and reversing in ARM assembly

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: Sea
item.description:
This is quite the compilation! I will go over this wiki later this week and append additions in the replies.

Read full topic

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: Retr1
item.description:
Red_Joker:

a list of sources for certain hacking tools

Services & Tools [Wiki] Wiki
Hello, 0x00’ers! @zSec gave us the idea to make a Wiki with working services for things such as email relays, SMS spoofing and the like. Feel free to edit this and add things you have tried and tested. The more we add in useful things, with a very quick way to access them, the more useful this page will become. The type of information included here, should not be content for teaching new concepts, but something that you can use for reference once you know the techniques. An almost cheatsheet f…

Read full topic

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
This is for useful links. If you’ve got some useful links to add, add them. I wouldn’t think a section for beginners is specific enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: Red_Joker
item.description:
@pry0cc, I have been sitting on this for a while and this goes for everyone but I wander if it would be a good idea to add a list of sources for certain hacking tools or at least a section for like Password Wordlists, stuff like that? Maybe add a section for beginners? My last question is, should we have a help section for certain resources? I am asking before I edit the Wiki.

Thank you for reading this even though I could have just edit the Wiki itself.

~Cheers!

Read full topic

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: ricksanchez
item.description:
@Sirius Do it! Its almost weekend anyway you wouldn’t have anything better to do anyway right…?

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: ricksanchez
item.description:
summoning the mighty @Sirius to copy & paste his post from here nicely formatted to this wiki

Big Edit:

____
YOU CAN ADD YOUR OWN STUFF TO THAT LIST.
IT’S FREE TO EDIT FOR EVERYONE.
SO DON’T COMMENT, JUST ADD IT

AS ALWAYS KEEP IT CLEAN AND CLASSY!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION
____

Read full topic

item.title: Useful Links! [Wiki]
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
As @SmartOne suggested. It would be really cool to have a wiki with useful links. Simply edit this topic and away you go!

Blogs

  • Security blog(s) overview
  • Penetration Testing Blog by @hkh4cks

News

  • The Hacker News
  • Security Affairs
  • WIRED (Security Category)
  • SANS Newsletter(s) (For NewsBites, you get to view opinions from the Editorial Board of SANS alongside the news)

Git repos

  • Awesome-Hacking
  • low level (Resources and articles for (but not limited to): reversing, security, …etc.)
  • Math Symbols as Code (cheat-sheet for explaining different math symbols as code)
  • Hacker Roadmap (overview of pentesting and helpful for beginners)
  • Hacking Security Ebooks(Free Security E-books to Download)
  • H4cker by The Art of Hacking
  • Awesome Hacking Search Engines

Tutorials

  • Cybrary - Online Free CyberSec Training
  • OpenSecurityTraining (Similar to Cybrary)
  • Crash Course - Computer Science Playlist [YT Channel]
  • Computerphile [YT Channel]
  • Hackers Arise

Misc

  • Every book in existence - Where DMCA’s power doesn’t reach.
  • Defcon Media Server - Contents of every defcon to date (include presentations’ videos)
  • Security Resources: Beginner to advanced for all security folks!
  • Wireless Passwords from Aiports & Lounges around the World
  • Surveillance Self-Defense
  • Free Programming Books
  • Password Lists
  • Free IT eBooks
  • NIST Computer Security Resource Center - Special Publications
  • DoX Format
  • SmashTheStack fileserver - Contains a very good disassembly tutorial, and some other goodies
  • Ansible vs Puppet vs Chef vs Salt vs Docker vs Vagrant
  • A list of VPS hosts that accept Bitcoin
  • FuzzySecurity - Contains a lot of tutorials and information about exploit development and low level security in general
  • azeria-labs - Great content about shellcoding and reversing in ARM assembly
